Legal_Issue: Whether the CHRC exceeded its jurisdiction or erred in law by disregarding evidence and failing to observe natural justice
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed that age 65 was frequently considered the normal retirement age
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate error or breach
Legal_Rule: Under s. 15(1)(c) of the CHRA, termination due to reaching the 'normal age of retirement' is not discriminatory
Procedural_Issue: Alleged failure to observe principles of natural justice
Review_Standard: Error in fact or law, procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: CHRC provided procedural fairness through written submissions
Key_Evidence_Considered: Collective agreement, definition of normal retirement age
Applicant_Challenge: CHRC disregarded evidence and lacked procedural fairness
Legal_Rule_Source: s. 15(1)(c) and s. 44(3) of the CHRA
Defendant_Response: Termination at age 65 was consistent with collective agreement and normal retirement age
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Complaint deemed unwarranted for inquiry under s. 44(3)
Applicable_Process: Administrative complaint process followed by judicial review
